gurmukhi: Aiq pRcMf blvMf bhur imil kY Bt Dwey ] Apny SsqR sMBwir lIey kir sMK bjwey ]
transliteration: At(i) Prachanndd Balvand Bahur Mil(i) Kai Bhat Dhaae|| Apne Shaastra Sanbhaarr(i) Leee Kar(i) Sankh Bajaae||
translation: Many powerful warriors went forward for fighting; holding their weapons they blew their conches;

gurmukhi: dÍwds Bwnn qwn kmwnin bwn clwey ] ho Xo brKy sr Gor mno prlY Gn Awey ]1664]
transliteration: Dvaadas Bhaanan Taan Kamaanan(i) Baan Chadhaae|| Ho Yo Barkhe Sar Ghor Mano Parlai Ghan Aae||1664||
translation: The twelve Suryas pulled their bows and discharged their arrows like the raining clouds of doomsday.1664.

gurmukhi: bwnin so bwnin kty kop qky jug nYn ] sRI hir so KVgyS qb irs kir bolXo bYn ]1665]
transliteration: Baanan(i) So Baanan(i) Kate Kop Take Joug Nain|| Srihar(i) So Khadgesh Tab Ris Kar(i) Bolyo Bain||1665||
translation: The king intercepted the arrows with arrows and looking furiously he said to Krihsna;1665.

gurmukhi: ikau ry gumwn krY Gn sXwm AbY rn qy puin qoih BjYho ] kwhy kO Awn ArXo sun ry isr kysin qy bhuro gih lYho ]
transliteration: Kio Re Goumaan Darai Ghan Syaam Abai Ran Te Poun(i) Tohe Bhajaiho|| Kaahe Kau Aandaryo Soun Re Sir Kesan(i) Te Bahurro Gadh Laiho||
translation: “O Krishna ! why are you egoistic? I shall cause you to run away from the battlefield just jow; why are you resisting me? I shall again catch you by your hair;

gurmukhi: AYry AhIr ADIr frY nih qokih jIvq jwn n dYho ] ieMdR ibrMc kubyr jlwiDp ko sis ko iSv ko hq kYho ]1666]
transliteration: Aire Aheer Adheer Darai Nah(i) Tokah(i) Jeevat Jaan Na Daiho|| Indra Biranch Kouber Jalaa Dhip Ko Sas(i) Ko Shiv Ko Hat Kaiho||1666||
translation: “O Gujjar ! are you not feeling afraid? I shall not let you go alive and kill all including Indra, Brahma, Kuber, Varuna, Chandra, Shiva etc.”1666.

gurmukhi: qau hI lau bIr mhoq ktw isMG Qo rn mY mn kop BrXo ] kr mY krvwr lY Dwie clXo kib sXwm khY nhI nYk frXo ]
transliteration: Tau Hilau Beer Mahot Kataa Singh Tho Ran Mai Man Kop Bdaryo|| Kar Mai Karvaar Lai Dhaae Chadyo Kabi Syaam Kahai Nahinaik Daryo||
translation: At that time, the mighty warrior Kata Singh, getting enraged in his mind and fearlessly taking his sword in his hand, fell upon the king; both of them waged a dreadful war,

gurmukhi: As ju`D duhUM niRp kIn bfo n koaU rn qy pg eyk trXo ] KVgyS kiRpwn kI qwn deI ibnu pRwn krXo igr BUm prXo ]1667]
transliteration: As Juddh Duhoon Nrip Keen Bado Na Ko( i)  Ran Te Pag Ek Daryo|| Khadgesh Kridaan Kidaibin(u) Praan Daryo Gir Bhoom Daryo||1667||
translation: None of them retraced even one step; ultimately Kharag Singh struck a blow with his sword and making him lifeless caused him to fall on the earth.1667.

gurmukhi: dyK dSw iqh isMG bicqR su TwFo huqo irs kY vh DwXo ] sXwm BnY Dnu bwnn lY iqh BUpq isau Aiq ju`Du mcwXo ]
transliteration: Dekh Dashaa Tih Singh Bachitra Su Thaadho Houto Ris Kai Vah Dhaayo|| Syaam Bhanai Dhan(u) Machadyo||
translation: Seeing him in this plight, Vichitra Singh who was standing there, came forward and waged a dreadful war with the king with his bow and arrows;

gurmukhi: sRI KVgyS blI Dn qwn mhw br bwn pRkop clwXo ] lwig gXo iqh ky aur mY sr GUim igirE Dr ieau Air GwXo ]1668]
transliteration: Srikhadgesh Balidhan Taan Mahaa Bar Baan Prakop Chalaayo|| Laag(i) Gado Tih Ke Ur Mai Sar Ghoom(i) Girio Dhar Io Ar(i) Ghaayo||1668||
translation: The mighty warrior Kharag Singh, pulled his bow in anger and discharged his arrow in such a way that it hit his heart and his head was chopped and fell down.1668.
